title: Shchastia faces most intense shelling since war began
content: SHCHASTIA, Ukraine - The Ukrainian-controlled town of Shchastia north of Luhansk was heavily shelled by Kremlin-backed insurgents on Jan. 14-15.  Locals say that it was the most intense shelling since the war began in April 2014. As a result, a power plant employee was killed, and two civilians were injured. Over 10 buildings were damaged.
author: Alexander Rychkov
